text:
I love Chipotle!!!!! The food here is excellent. You also cannot beat the price anywhere. The company is very respectful and practice their Food with Integrity motto. I think it is great to see a restaurant care as much about the source of their product as they do about what goes into their pocket. Many other companies should take note. 
The steak, chicken, pork and barbacoa are incredible. All slow cooked to perfection, the flavor profile of every ingredient that goes into each meal is compromised. 
I normally order the bowl here which i order with rice, black beans, med salsa, corn, sour cream, cheese, lettuce, and guacamole. Yuuummm...
So good and always enough left over for late night snacking. The chips here are fresh and perfectly salted and the salsas are full of flavor.
I will forever be a loyal customer at Chipotle!!
New respect for Chipotle - their mini series is funny & will raise awareness of US's ridiculous lack of attention to our politics effect on quality food supply.

Nothing really special about this branch. But they do a good job overall. With new employees there is always some variability as to the amount of ingredients they put in but nothing a friendly reminder won't fix ;)
The ingredients are always fresh and the facility is always clean. 
Keep up the good work!

My son and I went in tonight for dinner. Worst service ever. The first two girls pushed us along, my son was trying to ask her a question she just blew him off. He is eight years old. Not like he is a toddler running amuck. He order a kids # 4 which is a build your own tacos. We under stand that it only came with two sides. When he asked if he could have some lettuce she told him NO. That it would be an extra charge for for that. Are you kidding me for lettuce on a kids taco. I couldn't believe it. Especially after I just paid 2.00 for a skimpy side of guacamole for his taco. something restaurants should make a point of to their employees is that customers only go out maybe once a month or twice now, not like 5 years ago when it was 3 times so when it comes to making a choice where to go before they leave the house they think hmm..well last time I went there this or that happened, something as simple as they didn't even say goodbye or thank us as we were leaving and we tipped. Just some lettuce for thought chipotle.

Straight garbage. I had gift certificates so searched the chipotle w the highest rating. As a chef i was sickened. Rude service. No pride in their food. I asked for the fresh steak i saw being chopped behind the lady and she said "NO ITS THE SAME THING" so i told her no, i want the fresh stuff. She proceeds to dump the old meat on top of the new, I NEARLY LOST IT. couldn't believe how gross and rude that was. I give up on chipotle COMPLETELY.

Easy to order, create any meal that you would like, range from taco to burritos. Service is very friendly.  

I ordered a chicken bowl, the chicken was tender, and the salsa was refreshing.  The Rice was cooked well. Although the tables were not clean, and the condiments were dirty.

I went there today for my first time and the experience was amazing!  I'll totally go back again and again and tell all my friends to go to this location.  The staff was on top of everything, the restaurant was very clean, and the quality of the food was top notch.  Very friendly staff!  Best fast food experience I've had in Las Vegas since I moved here!

It's chipotle, so you know what you're getting, the food is solid, healthy or indulgent as you want it to be. The only reason  even putting a review up is because this location is well run, clean, and has great friendly staff.

Ordered a bowl to go. When I was about to finish my meal I realized there was something in my food.. I found a bee in my meal and almost threw up. Chiptole was my go to quick meals but damn.. How do you get a bee in your food..

I don't recommend this place , I'm sorry.

My friend and me eat today there and we are sick from stomach . Same feeling :(
Bad bad bad 
I ate steak burrito and my friend chicken salad

I visited this location today and was helped right away. I was unable to fax in my order sheet and went on to call the location. After briefly speaking with Yvette she told me that she'd transfer me to her ordering specialist but the called dropped. When I walked in the location Yvette helped me, and rushed my order.  It truly was great customer service! I look forward to many other lunches from Chipotle!

Horrible. I wouldn't recommend this place whatsoever. I've gone in a few times and every time I go the older lady cashier is giving a lot of attitude towards everyone and has a smug look on her face. The tables were dirty and when I informed the manager she laughed and said it was clean when there clearly was food everywhere. I ordered a chicken bowl and the cashier rung me up for a double chicken with extra guac. I didn't pay for it because it was wrong and refused until she fixed it. Everyone there has attitude and the manager always has a smug look with a clear attitude and she doesn't care about how her restaurant is. My friends and family and I have all experienced this.
Excellent customer service! Fast and efficient. I personally could do without the overzealous greeting when I walk it, but otherwise very impressed!!!
Excellent customer service!  Food was very tasty  I will certainly be back again, even though there is one closer to my home.

It's insane how consistently poor the service is at this location. The line always moves slow, there is never anyone at the register, the soda machine is constantly broken, and they frequently run out of ingredients. The last two times I've visited they were out of brown rice, this time they are also out of the corn salsa and other ingredients. I go here out of convenience but am going to start driving an extra ten minutes to visit Chipotle. The manager ought to be embarrassed by the way this location operates.

Wow, why didn't I think of this kind of restaurant to open?  What a super idea!  Fast, friendly service,  a simple menu, beautiful fresh food and something to please everyone.  We had a great time, got filled up, and felt good for having come to this location. A++
I love this place. Customer service is always superb and the food is great. I have been here many times and will continue to be a dedicated customer.

I love Chipotle, but this location is definitely substandard by franchise standards. I ordered online 30 minutes in advance and watched as 4 people got in line, had their orders processed, and received their food before they finally got around to serving me. What is the point in ordering ahead of time if you still have to wait behind customers who just walked in the door? The employees here are hard-working and friendly, but the manager definitely needs a talking to.

Ok...I love Chipotle.  It's pretty hard to mess that up.  I'm a super huge fan of being able to coach the exact distribution of the ingredients going into my burrito.  The cilantro-lime rice just makes the burrito.  Doesn't matter if you add the super yummy, well seasoned, chicken or the melt in your mouth carnitas...The food is always great.  

The only reason for four stars vs. five stars is the physical building.  The actual dining area is much smaller than most Chipotles that I've frequented and the vibe here felt a bit different too...Don't know quite how to explain that one so I know it's not much help.
Great service, always smiling employees, the food is better then most Chipotle locations in Vegas. Keep it up!
Will never come here again their rice was hard like always and the food was cold as usual hated it! !!!

I love chipotle and their food with integrity value. All restaurants should follow their example by only using meat free of antibiotics and hormones.  All of their food is delicious, and I'm happy that they offer a brown rice selection.

I love Chipotle. So much. I even ate there more during the e coli scare than I probably ever did before because I just didn't care if I got sick I wanted Chipotle that much. This last visit was pretty sucky. The service was wonderful- it's always pretty friendly and helpful. Unfortunately the shells... Those were stale and horrible. The taste ruined my entire meal and I had to scoop the filling out of the shells to actually eat it. Yuck.

So fresh! So yummy! And oh so healthy! 

Chipotle hit the spot for me and my girlfriend. Had a long day at work and we both wanted a quick dinner, nothing fastfood nor fancy! 

As a first time customer, I didn't realize its kind of like Subway, by telling the employees what u exactly want. Just more Gourmet! 
I ordered the chicken soft tacos which comes with 3! The guy asked me whether I wanted flour or corn taco...? Umm what? Lol. I didn't realize they offered that. I said regular, whatever that meant! Haha. Next, you can actually mix n' match with chicken, steak, or barbacoa (shredded beef). I had to try at least one that's different. Got 2 chicken tacos and 1 barbacoa. I added salsa, corn, blackbeans,  guacamole, sour cream, and lettuce! I must say it was muy delicioso!! The quality and freshness made this a healthy treat! Didn't feel bloated at all like I would when I grab mexican food at Robertos! Lol!

Okay, I've been here twice now since learning from their website about the Chipotle commitment to "Food with Integrity."  What does that mean?  It means, among other things, that 100% of the chickens they use are raised without the use of antibiotics.  100% of their pork comes from naturally raised pigs that are fed a vegetarian diet and never given antibiotics.  And 85% of their beef comes from naturally raised cattle (only because the supply presently cannot meet the demand).  

All this time, Chipotle was right under my nose and I'd been snubbing it because I assumed their food had no more integrity that Taco Bell's.  

Now I've been this location twice within the last week.  The first time I got  a barbacoa burrito bowl with black beans and rice.  The second time I got the same thing with the chicken instead of the barbacoa.  Both times I was really hungry and could only eat about half of the meal in one sitting.  So I got two meals out of it for a reasonable price.  Both times, the food was delicious and I felt like I was eating a healthy, nutritious meal.  

I also got, both times, the tortilla chips with guacamole.  Their tortilla chips are made fresh and have a really great, subtle lime flavor.   The guacamole is also made fresh.

This location is clean and well-maintained, and I have had no problems with the employees here.  They have been helpful and friendly.  From now on, Chipotle is going to be a regular stop when I want a quick, delicious, healthy and hearty meal.

Wow! The service is exceptional at this location. Came in for my usual salad and was greeted as always coming in.
I was blown away by your friendly staff and the cashier who went out of his way to offer me the new chorizo item. I mean, I like free food but he also asked how my day was going. 

Okay, the service is always awesome, but the offering of chorizo without asking went a long way with me. Go visit the friendly staff at this location!!!

Please keep up the great work!

Pros:
HUGE burritos.
DELICIOUS burritos.

Cons:
Way too many calories. 

Trying to lose weight right now, it sucks having to forfeit my Chipotle, but seriously, 1 burrito=2 lbs gained. Do deliciously huge portions always have to have thousands of calories.

Good food for the money.  I like the fact that I can stay relatively gluten free and still have good food.  I love the quality of the meat... and my favorite is the barbacoa beef.  Can you believe McDonalds owns this?  It's actually responsible eating!

I'm being a little hard on this store. Chipotle is my favorite fast casual and I live near this store and like it. But I do want them to improve, no particular criticism. They are clean and and the food is great.

So yeah, I would love to frequent this place, but there is an evil woman who always is in the first position and she doesn't give any rice beans or meat.  Every time she says if you want ONE more piece of chicken it's extra.  I drive by and if she is working I don't go in.

This particular Chipotle is outstanding.  I have eaten their 12 times and the service and food have been excellent.  They are also cleanliness freaks there.  If only my house was that clean.  Staff is wonderful and the food is always good.

Just went in to get my usual bowl to-go, excited because I love the food and haven't had it in a few weeks. Decided to pick some up from the location I regularly visit, and encountered terrible customer service from a lady with a tattoo on her right forearm that said "Steven". She would ask your basic questions such as what you'd like, and when you'd try and respond, she'd rudely enterupt you and just try to push you along like an assembly line. By far the worst customer service I've had at a Chipotle, and will not return to that location.

I hate lines, I hate telling people over a glass wall what I want but I craved mexican food and wanted something that was close to my house so I ordered online to save time and stress. I ordered it at 12:45 and it said pick-up would be ready at 1:15 so I arrived at 1:10. Not only was the burrito COLD but, it wasn't even what I ordered!

My online order:
****Barbacoa Burrito ($9.15) Brown Rice, Black Beans, Barbacoa, Fresh Tomato Salsa, Sour Cream, Cheese, Guacamole****

What they gave me:
****STEAK Burrito with WHITE RICE and BLACK BEANS**** that is it....

Can someone please explain how this is acceptable? It was also cold which means they must have made it within 3 minutes and it was sitting there the entire time. Now here is what really makes me mad. I don't eat steak, not by choice, I just can't because when I eat red meat it makes me sick like food poisoning sick so the fact that they put steak in my burrito just crossed the line. What a waste of time and money spent. 

Also, that $2 soda I paid for was DISGUSTING which I should have known after I placed my cup under the "Coke Zero" only to find out it was flat Sprite, probably should have tasted the "regular Coke" before leaving the location but I was hungry and just wanted to get back home to finish my lunch and then get back to work.

I honestly will never be stepping inside any chipotle ever again after this experience. This totally makes me laugh at those who want minimum wage to be $15 a hour when they can't even do a simple job right. So disappointed.

Had a Sofritas Burrito and it was perfect! The service is always good at this location and the line moves really fast. They keep the dining area reasonably clean and there's usually good parking available. Some of the tables are a little too close to the bathroom, but other than that this is a good location to eat at.

This was the worst chipotle we have had in a long time. The rice was clumpy and you couldnt taste the cilantro. The chicken looked ans tasted bad. The chips were brown/ burnt just and overall bad experience and regretting our choice to eat their today.

We all know what chipotle is. Locations vary of course. I came into this location because it was convenient after work. Parking was simple as always at these places. 

Walked in and there was no one there! So I ordered my items, always choosing to eat a bowl, veggies, chicken. Pico de gallo and medium sauce. Instead of a tortilla, I ask for chips. I actually really like their lime and salted chips. 

The staff was friendly and interactive. It got busy after I got my food. People were definitely coming in for dinner; some were picking up their online orders. 

I sat down and had my meal; the staff was cleaning and acknowleding my presence. I could see the steady flow of guests complete their orders. Each one satisfied with no complaints. 

This chipotle is also fairly clean. The floors and seats were clearly maintained well and clean.
 
The seats face the southeast area; so at least you get a view of the cars going by rather than just a parking lot! haha

I was excited when this store finally opened up on Sahara. Being a 3rd shift worker, you don't find a lot of places opened up after 7pm other than fast food joints. 

I ordered the Carnitas burrito bowl, which is pretty much a burrito with no tortilla. awesomeness's like a mega salad. :) I like the concept at Chipotle's...hmmm a Mexican subways? ha ha. The food there is as fresh as it gets and they also offer fresh chips and salsa (with the extra charge) along with what you order. 

Surprisingly they also sell beer there, so who says who can only get a drink with your burrito at a dining restaurant? Thumbs up on the liquor license.

Fills me up!

If you're hungry this place will definitely fill you up with the large burritos and my pick the naked bowl. I like choosing my own toppings and the food is fresh. The lines seem to go by quickly as well. 

I gave it a 3 because the food isn't always consistent and a chain like this should be. Sometimes the chicken is on the dry side or the rice has been overcooked. I hope these things can be worked out because the fresh concept is a great one.

Had my usual crunchy tacos with carnitas. Love the fast service and the food is predictably delicious. They keep this place clean which makes me happy since I'm a clean freak. The food is always made fresh to order and they have a great variety of toppings to keep your food tasting great.
Eat here often. Great food. Most meats are hormone free, antibiotic free. Healthy. Nice staff.

I had a nice lunch on Memorial Day at Chipotle.  I got the salad with steak, but no rice and beans and grilled veggies.  It was wonderfully seasoned and I loved it.  I will definitely come back for this same dish.  

I loved that they provide you a menu with the nutrition information on it and you can estimate what your calorie and fat counts are.  That does a lot to help you make better food choices. 

I also love the fun decor in the restaurant.  It's modern with a hint to an Aztec or Mayan  culture and it is well lit.

One thing I would like to see is that the seating area needed to be cleaned.  The only available table I had was not cleaned, so I had to sit at a table like that, yuk.  That made me begin looking around at the over all condition and the floors needed to be swept, too.  

Other than the cleaning the experience was nice and so I will be back.  I look forward to clean tables next time!

Love chipotle. This location is very clean and lots of seating, the food was fresh as well. The service was not great. The emoloyees were slow and disorganized. A long wait when there was only 3 people ahead of me.

I placed on online order at 6pm tonight for a 6:30 pm pickup. I ordered a veggie bowl via the app. I picked my food up at about 6:35 and I had to leave to get back to school in time. When I got to school and opened the container, my bowl looked disgusting. The lettuce was wilted and the guacamole was BROWN.  I scraped most of it off to eat the rest but brown avocado tastes horrible and it permeated through the whole dish. The corn salsa was tough, due to undercooked corn. I paid $7.00 for food that I took a few bites of and had to throw away. 

I tried calling the store number on the receipt but I could not get anyone to pick up the phone. 

I don't eat at Chipotle often, but this pretty much turned me off for good.

Great Burritos here. Made however you like with a nice variety of toppings!! For instance corn, guac, n' chopped tomatoes. Always fresh and made on the spot. Service has always been very acceptable here...

Got a burrito and by the time I got home which is literally 2 streets down the tortilla was so damn cold I was really questioning if they even heated it up. So  I proceeded to eat the burrito and the rice was so hard I swear it was sitting for a day or two that it was nasty at that point I lost my desire to even eat it. Really sucks they need to step up their food game because the staff here was extremely nice.

This is by far the most worst chipotle I've ever been too.  I just hated how none of the workers were friendly like any other ones.  Secondly they ran out of guacamole, and didn't apologize.  Bad customer service!! Very bad!!!

Got here and line was going super slow. The shift I ordered in had to be the slowest Chipotle workers I have ever seen .  Out of barbacoa, which I have never experienced . So I had to wait 15 minutes or get something else . I got the last scoop  of the Brown  Guac , which I was surprised they would even serve to a guest . The kitchen people were shouting out some chant in the back which was very unprofessional . The only professional I saw there was the man who was grilling . He was a very nice Asian young man who was very professional . This is not what I expect from a Chipotle. Felt like I was fishing bullets in the Matrix. When I was paying the lady at the counter said .. Is their anything you are waiting for ? as she charged my card.. I said , yes.. I'm waiting for you. WTF was that about ...
I love coming here, the line moves quickly, the food is fresh, you can create anything you want from healthy as you want to, well anything you want.  Never had a bad meal from Chipotle.

One of the better chipotles in Vegas. Every time I walk in I am immediately greeted by their friendly staff and they are always full of energy. They're always working hard and never goofing around. I get my usual chicken bowl with brown rice, lettuce, hot sauce, and black beans. I avoid sour cream and cheese due to my diet. I never had a problem with anything being undercooked nor have I ever got sick from the food.

If you're new to chipotle then here's how it works. You get to pick between a bowl (which is a burrito without the wrap), burrito, enchiladas, and other items on the menu such as a kids meal. You pick between white or brown rice, your usual shredded lettuce, and fajitas. They have a good amount of meat which include chicken, steak, shredded pork, and one more thing I can't seem to remember. At last the sauces! You have hot, medium, and mild. You also can add guac for extra $$, sour cream, corn, and cheese. Something I would get if diet wasn't a concern would definitely be a burrito with white rice, lettuce, chicken, hot sauce, sour cream, and cheese. 

SOME locations are really greedy with the meat. Some barely give you a scoop while others like this one gives a good amount. 

Overall this is one of my favorite locations for chipotle and I come here atleast once a week!

They are still stingy on everything, from rice, to corn. They didn't have vegetarian meat for this Friday in Lent season, I was told it'd be in next week. So, I dropped 3 stars to a 2. They're shouldn't be a shortage of anything at this well established location.

Very friendly location!  The workers here seem to genuinely enjoy their jobs, or at least put on a good attitude about it - even during busy lunch time.  Got my order quickly and correctly.  The inside is a little small but I always take it to go, so that doesn't impact my view on this one.

I actually tried the tofu here and it's not that bad.  Plus when I went, I got a coupon for a free burrito because I tried it.  Not too shabby.
It's currently closed. There is warning sign on the door with the headline "Don't panic".

Solid place for tasty eats.  The guac is very good and goes with everything.  :)  Most people are familiar with Chipotle, so I don't feel the need to write a lengthy review (for once!).  Let's just say that if one wants a quick, relatively healthy meal, choosing Chipotle is better than most places.  Select your form (bowl/salad/burrito), your meat (if desired), and your toppings and you're good to go.  Ol√©!

I've had a Chipotle a couple of times, particularly at this location. This location is very clean every time I do come in. My boyfriend is a regular, so some of the staff already knows his order. They are also very welcoming when we do come in. The portion sizes are fairly large depending if you get the burrito or bowl. I always get the kids meal taco kit and that's good enough for me.  It includes what ever meat you choose, and two sides like guacamole or mild salsa, chips, and a drink. My boyfriend GTE's the bowl, you have a choice of two different types rice, meat, sides. The guacamole, chips, and meat are always prepared fresh. There's nothing really bad I can say, it can be busy at times, and if they're new workers they can tend to be slow with your order.

came here with my sister and her boyfriend for a late night crave for chipotle. yes, we're huge fans since i was a fetus. its my home chipotle, just down the street from my casa. we came when they were closing t minus 30 minutes. we were set to pay, when i asked for guac. they had less than an ounce left, so they said they were out. bummed. that guac is the icing on the cake. no biggy, just like they didn't apologize for it. couldnt leave because they already prepared my bowl. but as i was grabbing some napkins, the customer that was behind us also wanted guacamole, but the manager apologized to them offering a free side of chips and salsa. what?!  i don't know if they were too lazy to make a fresh batch. where's the customer service at? luckily i love their food, but i dont feel like dining in here ever.

Always 4 stars.

It must be their delicious and mouthwatering steak. Its always so tender. i dont know how they do it. It had some good spices but my daughter always thinks its too hot. It doesnt taste like chain food, but i think its because its so fresh!

Their burritos have gotten a bit smaller but im not surprised with the economy and all.  Its still fairly reasonable for a steak burrito. 7.08 with tax! yesterday we went because they sent a B1G1 free :) Cant beat that!!

Perfection every time.. steak, cilantro rice, black beans, cheese, lettuce and sour cream. Don't forget the guac and chips! The chips are my favorite because they have that lemon zest taste. 

Next time I'd like to try their salad. it looks fairly large without the carb'd tortillas.
Probably won't come here anymore. The past couple times I've came, the steak has been barely cooked and so chewy and fatty, it was disgusting, it ruined my whole meal.

I love Chipotle's food when it's done right. This location on west Sahara needs some work. Employees are sweet but need a lot more training. The food wasn't up to par with other locations in other states. Is the meat supposed to be served cold?

My wife loves this place, but I can't figure it out.  The food is fresh, atmosphere is kind of unique, but the food is BLAND.  I've never been wowed by anything.   It's healthy to be sure, but so are rice cakes and celery.   I much prefer Zaba's to Chipolte.  Your mileage may vary...

Great place. Always fresh ingredients and the employees are stupendous. Unfortunately, not due to this restaurant, but a business move. They do not carry corn tortillas anymore(soft) huge upset. I was not expecting anything as far as compensation or not was I going to complain, but Raquel(I'm pretty sure i spelled that wrong) the manager comped my veggie bowl which was unexpected and I truly appreciate it. I go to this Chipotle at least 2-3 times a month. Trying to watch my figure. Lol

Fast. Friendly.  Tasty. Always get the rice bowl to go. White rice, black beans,  chicken, medium salsa, corn, lettuce,  cheese, sour cream.  
Would get it every day if I could afford it.

I went this chipotle many times. The workers never give me enough rice in the bowl. On several occasions, I asked for a quesadilla but they would always forget that they left it in the hot press. I went there today and I ordered a bowl with chicken and white rice. Then I went to the cashier they overcharged me way to much. The cashier told me that it was all ok that they overcharged me. I would advise future customers to double check the receipt

I tell you what I love chipotle, the food is great... But this specific location sucks. My tacos had no meat in them, the rice was soggy and worst of all the guacamole was not fresh at all. Very disappointed with my experience at this location. Will not come back to this chipotle!  Plus there was way to many people working the line. There was like 6 or 7 people starring at you as you order your food. How uncomfortable!

Wow best chipotle experience I have ever had! Very, very fast service, and the food was quality. Not like every locations I've been to the employees here are very gracious and quick. I got my food quickly and it was prepared flawlessly. I also really enjoy eating out a lot because I work in doors almost every day. Dave and Staff always make me feel at home.
Went here tonight for steak bowl and steak burrito for myself and fiance we found a bandaid in our food. Tried to call and no one would answer. Absolutely disgusting will not be back
Love this place, awesome service, awesome workers!!! Would def visit again. My fav is chicken queso, YUM!!

The food is very delicious the prices are  very reasonable the customer service is great I enjoy eating there my favorite is the chicken and steak burritos the rice is amazing and also the black beans I like this food because is not greasy and is healthy I highly recommend them.

If you've been to Chipotle, you know what the food is like. This is more a comment on both how fresh they seem to keep their food and the people who work there. 

BOTH ARE AMAZING.

Their fajita veggies always have the perfect amount of that delicious charred flavor (no barely cooked onions here - they're actually grilled like they should be). 

More importantly, the people who work here are actually friendly and good at their jobs. I've never had a messed up order or encountered anyone who wasn't like, the best ever at customer service. I've seen more than a few rude customers here though, and I'm always amazed at how nice the people behind the counter are. Seriously. Best Chipotle I've found in Vegas.

Placed my order on the application got there it was not ready had to wait for them to make it. What was the point of using the application if I have to wait? The Arroyo crossing location had my food waiting and ready for me when I used the application before. After waiting at this location my food was horrible the chicken is burnt and crispy yuck!  The vinaigrette for the salad was extremely salty. This location is right near my house but after this experience I won't go back. The Arroyo crossing location is way better!

Usual Chipotle.  However, this establishment has a bit of a smaller footprint than most.  Also interesting is that they actually use a not-so-spicy corn compared to some others that I've been.

The big thing here is that they pretty much use free-range everything.   I know it sounds silly, but there was an article in some business magazine a few months ago that basically wrote about how their meats taste better due to this shift.  And they do!  Also, if you've never been to this chain, they make pretty much everything from the meats to the guac fresh.  I've actually had to wait on guac to be made before at another chain.

I personally recommend the burrito bowls.  Less mess since you can eat it with a fork.  But, that's just me.
I didnt time it, but i think i spent less that 30 seconds from when i walked in till the time i walked out with my food. Thats fast and healthy. Hard to find that combo.

Omg! The manager is amazing!

Had to come all the way back because they got my online to-go order wrong. Expecting to have to be defensive when the manager came out he was so nice and offered to make me an entire new one! Schocked because all he had to do was add what was forgotten. But I did appreciate it because by the time I went home and went back to the store the food was wayy cold.

10 Stars for the way he handled my problem!

This location has horrible customer service, minus the store manager. I went there with my bf and had my own vegan food, the guy at the location yelled at me to immediately stop me before I even could walk through the door. I felt like I had a bomb in my hand or something. He said I couldn't come in with my food. So I had to wait outside in the scorching heat, until my boyfriend came out wondering why I'm standing outside. Eventually the store manager let me come in and eat my food with my bf who was eating there. I guess he thought my food was going to cross contaminate chipotles food?! Lol the nerve of them to say something like that. Thank you to the manager who let me come in. She was nice and apologized on his behalf, however, how he said what he said made me feel like he needed to know how his energy effected me

Our team enjoyed lunch today with many fine burritos and chicken tacos!

Great flavorful southwestern food in a hurry!

A+ service!  We'll be back!

I eat Chipotle almost 3 times a week and no only pay extra for avocado or etc, but I've never been in this location,  then lemons I asked twice to changed it one smells terrible then I asked for another one and I put it now my whole food taste horrible , I won't come to this location  ever again, they charge u 2 $ for no even the half of song of avocado they give less and less every time. (I love Chipotle but I won't come again to this location ) the personal and employees are nice is just the quality of the food is not fresh at all.. it's all and taste bad

This is my favorite Chipotle. They always serve good food  and have excellent service. The employees are spectacular, and treated us with much kindness. This came as a surprise as I've been to many locations in which the employees seem tempted to kick you out the door as soon as you walk in.

I've been here a half a dozen times. My girlfriend loves this place. Me, I guess I'm just not a fan of their food.

Place is always clean, staff is friendly and the line moves quickly.

There food just doesn't do it for me. But give it a try if you like Chipotle.

This place is very busy at lunch!

The place is clean and there are plenty of places to sit inside.  When tables empty out, I actually notice the employees are there moments later to clean up.  They also offer to take your trays and baskets.

I usually get the Vegetarian burrito: rice, black beans, fajitas (bell peppers and onions), pico de gallo, cheese, sour cream, guacamole, lettuce and corn.  My burrito comes bursting at the seams with this combination.  

I've even had the person that wraps the burrito plead for help from her co-workers for another piece of foil.

Another plus is that they serve minute maid lemonade!

The employees at this area are very nice and professional and I enjoy their cheery disposition and enthusiasm.

Bruh. Came here on a friday and there was a line? Like seriously hurry up I'm in a rush. I wanted steak they said "hey can u wait its too spicy!" so i wait a long time for them to cook me a new one and its CHEWY! I got the carnitas and it was honestly just cold. I liked the water cup cuz i put soda in it! gottem! anyway yeah not the best. And why can't i throw away the baskets?? Mind your business tf

It's hard to go wrong with Chipotle. This location is in a pretty good area, no bums to bother you or anything. The food here has the same, great, Chipotle quality that everywhere else has. The customer service here is excellent. Enjoy your Chiptole!

This place just gets worse by each visit. Rude customer service. Burnt chicken. Can't even taste the flavor it's just literally burnt. Never given a solid amount of anything I order. I don't pay what I pay to get less than 1/2 a spoon of what I order. I rather drive an extra 7 miles to another location because this one sucks.

I absolutely love this place, I've been going there for about 4 years. February 2013 I went on a Chipotle diet and lost 40 lbs eating nothing but there wonderful fresh foods. I've gotten to know all of the employee's and management along the way and they treat me like 100% family. 
Special shout out to Bree & David! I also love love love the biodegradable packaging used.

11/24/2014 (UPDATE) *****
Today was my 100th Check in at this location!!! 
Another shout out for this location, I travel for business to AZ, CA & NV
So I eat at Chipotle in a lot of cities none live up to this location. 
I have NEVER been disappointed with the food or service at this amazing Chipotle. Keep me the great work my friends!
Great food and fast great service. Cafe rio is also good in the same shopping center.

Chipotle. self explanitory, no advertisment needed.... its simply amazing.  The rice 
bowl with double rice, with that savory chicken ( of course you need to have a double
serving!) Im not sure what seasoning is in the rice and chicken but the combination
of the two mixed with the shredded cheese, pico de gallo, and the homemade
Guacamole! doesnt even matter if theres an up charge. its that good! The location
of this Chipotle is close to the house, the staff is friendly, and the are sure to keep
everything fresh and timely. great experience everytime. my only complaint is... well 
there is none. definitely top 5 things I'd want stranded on an island.

After I informed the staff that all the tables were dirty, nothing was cleaned in the time it took us to eat, about 20 minutes. Others just cleaned the tables themselves, not a single employee came out to even check.

There were 6 people behind the counter and one person cooking in the back.  Business was brisk, but not to the point of being overwhelming. They ran out of fajitas vegetables and it took over 8 minutes to get more.  

Poor leadership and poor planning on the part of management.

Very unimpressed with this location.

Love chipotle and this location. Didn't realize how much I loved it until I moved and there was no chipotle around. It's always fast and friendly service even though the volume of the store is very high. Every time I come in, it's packed and I'm usually in and out 9 out of 10 times. Tables are pretty clean and well kept.
The food wasn't that good. . After I ate it, my stomach was upset for hours.... Seemed to me it was over priced.
Yummy food you can get awesome things that make you stuffed but it is also good. Line goes by quick and you get to pick what you want on your meal.

Wonderful food with fresh ingredients and a friendly staff make me frequent this place quite often.... I'm in a wheelchair and this place is very wheelchair friendly... This location is particularly nice because the ingredients can be seen from a low profile and I can see what I'm ordering in my burrito.. (  the location on Lake Mead however has a barrier I'm not able to look over ...but still a nice location ) 

I ordered the pulled pork burrito with Corn, Black Beans , Lime rice , cilantro and guacamole.... with a side of chips and salsa..... Nom Nom Nom... It was soooo good!! They packed a lot of stuff on the burrito...

They are really nice at this Chipotle and Customer Service Was on point , I became a regular here and in between classes I would come here and definitely filled me up  And A great Employee by the name of George Had ExcTellent customer service was Genuine Not Fake Like and me and my friend reall Enjoyed It Thanks Keep Up the great work
As good as it gets for slow carb. Love the Barbacoa burrito bowl!

I have never heard of "Chipotle" before but my husband wanted to try it while on vacation in Las Vegas... It was surprisingly delicious! I got the chicken bowl with white lime cilantro rice, corn, and salsa. I didn't get a whole lotta "extras" but it was so refreshing. Maybe because we were in buffet gluttony and this was "light" compared to what I was shoving down my esophagus for the first 4 days of vacay. Oh, and it was cheap! Nice! They should open one in Hawaii :)

Good little lunch favorite. After a meeting at the local Starbucks I popped in to grab a veggie burrito bowl not a vegetarian but too cheap to pay a $1.80 for a scoop of guacamole...its the principle! Plus I need to control my meat intake anyway :)

Chipotle never disappoints the food and service is always very consistent they do a phenomenal job of training. Although I have to say this is the 1st time I have ever been in one with a dirty bathroom. 

I truly hate this bathroom's must be clean. However in their defense the reason it smelled like urine is because clearly this was a person's 1st encounter with peeing in a toilet...word of direction to this person wherever you are.  The urine goes in the toilet not on the floor around the toilet...come on people. 

However, no excuse Chipotle monitor your bathrooms better and keep it clean.

Friendly spot. never a long line. The manager here is awesome, hes even comped me 2-3 times for having to wait 2 extra minutes for steak. I am low carb so the salad with chicken and steak is the go to

This one is located in the Ashley Furniture strip mall on the corner of Sahara and Fort Apache. This location's our new go-to since moving into the area, last March (we go to two other locations (Fort Apache/ Trop & Arroyo) but this is the most frequented out of the three). This one doesn't seem so busy, but we usually get here at lunch time. This one is pretty clean (and so is the bathroom). 

The shape is like a backwards letter L, with the left front of it being the food prep and checkout line. Next to that area is the fountain drink machine, the napkins, the sauces, the forks, and the straws. The seating majority is small tables along the right side of the restaurant. (There is one large table as you walk in.) No outside seating. The bathroom is located at the far back left of the restaurant.

The food is always good. We (my son and I) split the bowl- regular rice, meat, fajita veggies, black beans, corn, sour cream, cheese, and lettuce (I love the salsa but it is too spicy for my son), but the picky eater doesn't like onions, so I eat them. Sometimes we get chicken, sometimes we get steak. I love the barbacoa but sometimes it is too wet and can be fatty. (I really miss the chorizo, that was my absolute favorite.) Hubby gets a burrito. Chipotle is a weekend staple for our family. The service is always good. Friendly and fast, that's a plus. Always a good experience here.

Closed on Easter sunday- we didn't know. Our son was so upset, he was crying.

So yeah, I can eat here. A LOT. Fast, friendly and FRESH. Not a trio you find in Vegas very often. I like how all of the food they use is local, to minimize the impact on poor mother earth. I like how the meat is "hormone- and all the other bad crap you don't want in your belly" -free.
I like how it is pretty reasonably priced, given the huge size of the burritos. 
I like how the paper napkins have personalities and little quotes. I like how they keep the line moving, and pretty much call to attention the jack asses standing in front of you with their mouths open as they peer with squinty eyes with the "I just can't decide" face. There are like, 6 things on the menu. Come ON, people! I like how if you are a vegan or a veggie, you can still eat here and not want to slit your wrists. (I was meat and dairy free for 10 months last year. Trust me. It's hard.)
But mostly, I love how fast I scarf down the food and feel good about myself afterwards. Fast food that won't make you fat! All they need is Wi fi so I can ipad here while I stuff my face and I'd be SET. 
 Yum O!

I LOVE Chipotle! The staff is super sweet and most talk in Spanish. Its funny because they think I'm a gringa and I'm totally not, so when I speak to them in Spanish they get all giddy. 

We went there today for lunch and I had a chicken burrito (like always) and man was it super yummy!! I also had some chips and guacamole which was excellent! I love how you can taste that everything is FRESH and not frozen! I also love the salt they have there; its like a lime sea salt.... totally delish!

The hot salsa is also super yummy and I always get extra! Beware because my bf said its spicy!

I shouldn't have to say my order 5 times to the server. "How can I help you. Steak bowl steak taco. White rice. What kind of meat. Steak. What on the taco ? White rice. What kind of meat. Steak!!!! Your people need to learn how to listen. Crappy service

One of the stingiest Chipotle I have ever been to!!! Our group of 4 arrived in Vegas and were in a rush to grab dinner. We stopped by Chipotle and we were jipped! I got a bowl with brown rice, fajita veggies, chicken, mild & medium salsa, corn and lots of lettuce. The first girl doing the tortilla/rice/veggies was STINGY AS F. She spread out the rice so much while only giving you a little to begin with and she gave me about 5 .. literally thats FIVE pieces folks, of the fajita veggie mix. Really? I didn't even want to bother. The party behind us saw our orders and mentioned to the workers they would pay for extra meat and etc after seeing the amounts they gave us!

Luckily the lettuce girl and cashier were nice so they get +1 star. Ugh.

This review is solely based on their new queso. It's awful. Maybe we got a bad batch but it had zero flavor and was almost gritty. Cafe rio has the best queso but we prefer chipotles meats. Was really looking forward to the queso I thought they would do a great job with it. I'll sample it next time and see if it's the same crap or if we caught a bad batch.

" FOOD WASTERS "

super weird, i really liked this location until today 

basically went in and asked for a bowl with only beans and rice like i've done so many times before (i get only beans and rice because it is cheap and actually tastes good by itself) when i asked the lady she started to fill my bowl up to the top with beans and rice, now they are supposed to charge by the scoop but most of the time the workers understand that your only getting beans and rice and it doesn't effect them if they give 2 or so scoops of each and charge for 1 each, well when i got to the front there was a manager there and she asked how many scoops were in my bowl and the lady that scooped it said 4 but i did not ask for 4 so i was only trying to pay for what i asked for witch was only beans and rice so the manager threw away the bowl filled with rice and beans and made the lady scoop me only 1 of each 

like instead of giving me the food and telling the lady later that you only are supposed to give 1 scoop each you would rather throw the food away, that's pretty insane but then again who isn't now a days, just another reason why i have no faith or hope for the future 

stop wasting food, start treating humans like humans 

bet ya didn't think i had a yelp :/
For the price of the food the meal was filling and delicious, the burritos are huge and assembled to order, the people behind the counter were fast and consistent and quick!

I believe in second chances but I'm still wary of eating their meat. So I stuck to my favorite: vegetarian tacos. The beans aren't mushy, the fajitas veggies have crunch and flavor, and they're cheap. My lunch was under $3 (one taco and a water cup). I'm not big on heavy lunches so this was a quick bite and it satisfied me until evening.

I asked my 5 year old what she wants for dinner and she said "Chipotle"!!  We found this one, ordered and guess what?  I forgot my debit card at home!. I insisted that  I'd be right back with my card but they insisted that I take my food while it was warm.  Totally awesome and unexpected.  will be leaving a large tip next time around.

If you are a Mexican of heart, then I probably won't recommend you to go to the Chipotle. This is a Mexican restaurant with an "American fusion"  lol... Although, it is not 100% authentic Mex is  great for the buck. You cannot go wrong with any item from the menu; they offer burritos, tacos, salads and bowls (my favorite). You can select the type of meat, the spiciness of the sauce, white or brown rice, pico de gallo, corn, sour cream, cheese, well you get the point!  Fast service so you will be in and out of this place.This restaurant is great but, I wouldn't recommend it as a spot for your first date! lol

It's Chipotle, what do you want?  The chicken was a little fatty.  I will say that for $1.95 extra, and they will let you know this every single time you ask for it, is worth it as the helping is a pretty decent one.

I've been eating chipotle for years and this location is one of the reasons!  I buy chipotle pretty much once a week, the bowl is very nice since its pretty much a salad that way haha!  this is a great lunch and its not super bad for you like say jack in the box is.  

If you have never tried this then I would suggest getting a bowl and then see how you like the items that they have.

I need a Chipotle fix about once a week!  Love the service here,  always willing to make it just the way I want it! Love that it is all non-gmo and red peppers, yah! Chips and salsa are the best! There's a reason they have a line sometimes,  food and service is great! Best fast food Mexican in my book!
Like every other chipotle, this is exactly the same. Minus one star for the rip-off guacamole. $1.99 for a spoon of guac? Holy shit
Worst chipotle I have ever been too. A code to get into the restroom which none of the employees seemed to know.
Their computers were down: Yet the staff remained polite, calm, and professional.  My first time at this location -- how friendly the staff was blew me away.  I'll be back to visit again!

This chipotle gets three stars for friendliness when you walk in the door but the food is not good so I'm giving it two stars. I keep eating there wanting to like it since it is my neighborhood Chipotle, but I'm going to have to give it up. The food is bland. At most Chipotle restaurants usually the barbacoa meat is full of flavor - not at this one. The beans that came with my burrito yesterday not only had no flavor, but instead of the tan color you expect, these were gray. The flavorful cilantro lime rice that chipotle is famous for was dry and unflavorful with no lime flavoring. When I asked for cheese to be put on my big burrito the guy sprinkled about a quarter of a teaspoonful on it and slid my burrito down the line. I had to ask the girl for more. My daughter got a burrito bowl that was also blech. She asked me that we never eat there again. The bill was $23 so I suppose I won't be eating there again because it was not what you would expect for that price.

Truly one of the rudest customer service experiences I've had in a long time. I ordered a burrito while there to go. But when I got to my car and began to eat the burrito I saw that the person I'd ordered from forgot to put the last 3-4 ingredients in that I had requested as I went to pay the cashier. When I went back in to tell the cashier, actually the guy next to the cashier, that my order was incomplete, he spoke to me very patronizingly and suggested that I must have not have ordered correctly. Then he told me to tell them what what was missing and they'd give it to me on the side!! On the side? I told him I shouldn't have to get it on the side because their person made a mistake. Then he instructed me to go back to the beginning of the line and order the burrito again, but when I saw him making faces and rolling his eyes at the other employees standing there, I asked for a refund instead. I was so shocked and disgusted by this unprofessional behavior! I will NEVER go there again. Such a negative experience.

Your average Chipotle. I like the idea of Chipotle, but all the meat options are too spicy for me (though to be fair, I'm a wimp with spicy). But it's a great option for the Slow Carb diet. The food is great (if a bit spicy) and they worked us through the lunch time rush quickly.

This has to be the friendliest Chipotle I've ever been to.  I was greeted, not once, not twice, but 3 times walking in the door!  Every employee had smiles on their faces as I placed my order.  

I typically get a burrito bowl to go with white rice, chicken, veggies, sour cream, corn, pico and guac.  Today was no different, and it was awesome.  I would highly recommend this Chipotle over another random one in the valley.

Bon Appetite!

Considering chipotle is one of my favorite places to eat, I've been able to frequent many locations in the Las Vegas area. The location on Ft. Apache is by far one of the best not only for freshness but also for service. 

Chips are essential to any "bowl" and they have never disappointed unlike other locations who tend to run out of chips later on in the evening. Not only are they well stocked among other things but they have the friendliest of employees. Everyone from the beginning of the line to the cashier were extremely friendly! Particularly Riqo! 

Keep up the great work Ft. Apache Chipotle! :)

Yes, I'm reviewing Chipotle.  Yes, they're a franchise.  Yes, they're owned by McDonalds..You got a problem with that?  Suck it.

If you've been to Chipotle before, you pretty much know what you're gonna get here: a ginormous burrito bursting at the seams, which is why they wrap it in tin foil!

I've never had a bad meal at ANY Chipotle.  I've never left unsatisfied and this franchise is no exception.  Yeah, I'm a creature of habit and I've only ordered the Chicken Burrito, but hey - Why mess with perfection?  I go here at least twice a week for lunch unless I decide I'm going to stick to my stupid diet (once a blue moon).

This particular franchise is always clean and the staff is always friendly and I trust them with my health and my palate.

Dos pulgares up, esse!

Tip: For some reason, whenever you order the chips and salsa, they get stingy with the salsa.  Watch them pour it into the cup and yell at them if they don't fill it to the rim.

I have a love hate relationship with this place.  I think their prices are fair for their burritos and for the guacamole and chips and they give you a good size portion of guacamole which I really like.  I like that they have brown rice now and I really enjoy their salsas.  But my BIG HUGE COMPLAINT with them is VERY simple. 

GET A WHOLE WHEAT TORTILLA!!!!!!!!!!!!!

How can a place that a prides themselves on healthy, organic, fresh made blah blah blah not have a wheat tortilla??? They only have white flour.

Yet right across the street from them at Rubios (which I LOVE) has had wheat tortillas for years now.  

Sorry but if you want a 5th star from me, get whole wheat as an option.

I've been to this location several times and have always had a pleasant experience. Usually there's not much of a line, however being that today was their Teacher Appreciate deal, there was quite a line this time. Teachers like to eat. The line was moving smoothly until the lady in front of me was up to bat. I would hate to see her lesson plans because clearly she hadn't planned out her trip to Chipotle. After she tells the staff member that she wants a burrito and the tacos, she then preceded to phone a friend. Apparently neither herself or her friend had ever been to Chipotle before because she went on to list and describe every item offered to her friend on the phone. The staff was so wonderful though, trying to be nice to her. This woman just kept talking and would not get off the phone. They mentioned to her several times that they needed to keep the line moving but the woman didn't seem to care, she continued her phone discussion on whether or not her friend wanted sour cream. The staff would nervously look at me and then at the line, which was getting longer every minute. I felt bad for the staff. The rest of us stood there awkwardly waiting for this woman to finish her order. Nothing we could do. Once she finished, they zipped me through right away. I think the staff that worked today should get a bonus- they did an excellent job. We were a room full of hungry teachers but they were working as hard as they could, with smiles,  and this teacher appreciates that. 
And for the people who rated them less than 5 stars because their orders were wrong: you're idiots. You are literally standing there and you can see them making your order. You don't get to go home and blame your missing lettuce on the staff, next time pay attention!
Letting sick employee stay and contaminate people's food.  Chipotle management is retarded. Chipotle is on my NEVER list

I have probably been here more than 20 times & and I have zero complaints about this. Food taste like No other. I always get the chicken burrito or the steak burrito & and I get pretty much every topping you can possibly put inside the burrito. Haha hey why not. For $6.50...there's no any other place will fill you up like this. I always have leftovers to  take home.

The young man preparing my food was nice, but there was no fresh guacamole lettuce or corn out and he scraped out the last little bit of each to put on my bowl which was not the proper amount. I visit chipotle every single day at work and other locations in Las Vegas and this was by far the worst bowl I've ever been given. It was short of everything. Then the cashier said yes, they have all of the fresh guacamole and corn and what not but they don't have time to put it out. I said if they would putting it out soon I will wait. It doesn't matter how long it takes, I just want fresh ingredients and the proper amount. 
For almost $10 a plate, I refuse to be gypped by another restaurant chain that is just trying to save money and skimp on what they give their guests. Looks like I will continue to visit every other chipotle restaurant in Las Vegas except this one. It's funny because I was only a moment away from deciding to go to Rubio's across the street instead. Should have gone there. Politeness is not enough anymore and companies need to understand that they can't rip off your guests; those guests will go elsewhere and get what they're paying for. Furthermore, I work in high end retail sales, so I know a little something about customer service. This behavior does not fly.. 

Update: the next day I returned to speak to the manager about their policy and she definitely agreed that does not make sense to give the scrapings of the dish to your guest when they could excuse themselves and give fresh ingredients which are sitting right below the counter. She offered a refund but I just asked for a quesadilla instead. Fresh and proper. Changed review from one star to three.

Their barbacoa burrito is SO flavorful, I wish could eat this everyday ;-)

Service was speedy and helpful at this location. The music is a tad on the loud side and it's actually a bit chilly, but that's ok when your food is spicy.

The two star was very well deserved for this specific Chipotle location. Especially when you're from out of state and you're craving it and you take your food back to your hotel and run into a huge food disappointment.

For the record: Let me just say that I am a huge Chipotle fan.  I have never had a bad experience in any other Chipotle.

I'll make it simple. 
1. Something  was added to guacamole.  It had a distinct flavor. It had a lot of blackness in it.  Which means that they didn't take the time to pick it out. Not even for presentation.  The color was different as well.  

2. Chips were stale

3. Rice was uncooked. It almost felt that they mixed a raw batch with a cooked batch.

4. Black beans were hard

5. Chicken in quesadilla was not as tender as I'm use to.

Five thumbs down gets 2 star rating.  Sorry!
Services is amazing!! Food we all know is good but the sevice is always great, thanks guys!

I have been here several times and the food (except for the tortilla chips) is always spot on. The staff is always friendly. The chips always stale... never fails... very disappointing.

The location is always playing super loud music which makes any type of meeting or phone call impossible. This location is not well maintained and not very clean and personally I don't like getting utensils from a common bucket that are not individually wrapped - so take out to eat at home is perfect - eat in - never.

4 stars for the guacamole alone. I enjoy it so much that I have been known to take it as "my dish" to a potluck gathering. I am tempted to say it is the best guacamole ever, and I wouldn't be surprised if they have an evil secret ingredient that makes it so good. Every time I visit, I am re-surprised by its quality, and their chips complement it perfectly. 

What else do I eat? My standard order is either crunchy tacos or a vegetarian burrito bowl. For the most part, all of the ingredients are fresh, and the vegetarian burrito bowl is wonderful because you can get the onions and peppers AND guacamole at no extra charge. And, they now carry brown rice!

The quality of service can vary drastically. Some employees have no problem being generous with toppings. Others can be downright snarly. Overall, however, when I am at a loss for what to eat and need a quick, reasonable healthy bite nearby, Chipotle will do just fine as long as I get my guac!
Good food, great service! And i love that chipotle uses responsible suppliers.

The food of course is excellent with the exception that they need to do a better job trimming the chicken. In terms of customer service this particular location is horrible!  Huge negative attitudes by most of the employees. When they are running low on any ingredient especially guacamole, I would wait until they replenish the supply or they will clearly skimp. When I called the AA lady with the nose ring out, she was an absolute bitch. I grabbed a card for David, and one for Zena, when I called to discuss what transpired they did not even answer the phone. I am a big fan of Chipotle; however I would recommend staying away from this location especially when they are busy.

Yum! Chipotle!

One just opened up on the corner of West Sahara and Fort Apache, where the old Blockbuster used to sit. Today is opening day and how can I resist a visit? I swing by around 8:30 after work to find a line around 10 people deep. There are a few tables being used by patrons but mostly people are ordering to go. The inside looks like every other Chipotle. Granted it was super clean since today was the grand opening.

I ordered the Chicken burrito ($5.85) and a Barbacoa Burrito ($6.10) for a friend. The line process did take a little bit since the employees were new. Give them a week or two to get a feel for it and then the lines will probably fly faster. 

The food is pretty consistent to every other Chipotle. What can you say? Its a chain restaurant! I'm definitely still a fan of Roberto's but I can see myself dropping by here once in a while.

Well it's chipotle if you haven't been to Chapala yet then you probably left under a rock they have balls burrito salad's tacos basic Mexican food there's usually not a long line weight because they become so proficient at serving The people. I've been to a lot of different chipotles every once in a while though I go in and you get your cashiers not too nice or had a bad day but other then that I love eating at chipotle usually do every other week

This place allows you to select how you want it. You can have it as a burrito, or a bowl, tacos that are soft or hard, and even a salad. This place is great for a light, quick, simple meal that you know will be as natural as you can get it. And if you are watching carbs, this place can be a nice option. 

Today I had the Carne asada burrito. I wasn't watching carbs this week, so I enjoyed the big stuffed burrito with extra chips and salsa. It comes with rice, your choice of beans, (I like black beans), you choose your meat, I got the carne asada, it's usually tender and seasoned well. I like the mild salsa, reminds me of pico de gallo, then I add the cheese and sour cream. That's a pretty big burrito!

What I like about this place is its commitment to quality, their products are natural and fresh and I know that eating hear makes me feel more healthy! (even if the burrito has way too many calories).

I love Chipotle. I know it's a chain and all, but they do what they do so well! In Northeast Ohio, where I'm from, the line will stretch out the door and around the corner.  Not so here in the Southwest, but that's to be expected, as there are more Mexican restaurants (pseudo and authentic) to choose from.

The fresh, organic ingredients at Chipotle are a real draw for me. But I admit, this is a "gateway "restaurant; when I'm falling off the raw/vegan/whole foods wagon, I come here because they serve fresh, organic, whole foods- so how bad can it be? But honestly, it's a slippery slope from here.  

What I love about Chipotle is that their chips taste fresh, their guacamole is the best of all the chain restaurant guacamoles I've tried so far, and they season their foods nicely so that everything is very flavorful. I feel like I'm getting a good deal for my $8. Their menu is small, but that's fine- a bigger menu may cause them to slack off on the quality. Can't have that!!  

I always get the Burrito Bol. It even tastes good the next day- just get the guacamole and sour cream on the side.

My very first Chipotle experience!
The place itself was very nice, and clean.  Their burritos, and guacamole are delicious!  Unfortunately, it was somewhat difficult to communicate our order to the employees.  For example, we would ask for cheese on our burrito, and the employee would nod, and not put it on.  Speaking to them in Spanish didn't seem to help either, so it might have just been very loud on their side of the counter.  
Also, it's a bit pricey for the kind of food that it is.  We had a buy one, get one free coupon, but I don't think I'd go often at regular price.

I would have given Chipotle a higher rating, but while finishing the last half of my burrito, I bit into the biggest piece of chewy, veiny... cartilage? Ew.  The burrito was awesome, but that seriously turned me off.   :(
Since I've never had weird chicken parts in my food at Zaba's, I'm pretty sure I'll just keep going there.

I'm a huge fan of Chipotle, just not of this location. The staff here is slow, unfriendly and seem to be on auto pilot.

We've been here several times. Yesterday was our most recent visit. There was only one person in line ahead of us, but they were slow helping her and afterwards, filled a to go order that had been faxed in with 4 meals rather than offering to help us. When they finally got to us, they asked my boyfriend and I each twice what we wanted because they didn't listen the first time. When my boyfriend ordered the girl asked which salsa he wanted he told her, she then ignored him, filled 2 to-go salsas for another order, then paused, and re-asked him again which salsa he wanted. It was so obnoxious. He told her to go light on the sour cream, she again ignored him and piled it on. He was pretty pissed and told her, but we didn't want to wait for her to remake the whole meal so he just scooped it off when we sat down.

As for the food, it's good. One of the things we love about Chipotle is the consistency in taste and quality. We love their burrito bowls and their tacos. Yum!

I go to this Chipotle at least once a week and the employees are always smiling and making the experience wonderful. Customer Service is so important and this location has it locked. I want to shoutout to Mariah who is always a smiling face and so kind whenever I come in. She goes above and beyond to make sure her customers are happy with their experience when they leave. A well deserved recognition! ROCKSTAR EMPLOYEE
#chipotle #chipotlelv #lasvegas #employees #recognition #customerserviceatitsbest #customerservice #awesome #thankyou

I gave them a one star because how ridiculously unprofessional they are. Not just me. But another lady wad upset because we both had the same problem about them not having a certain item. The lady who was going to help us went to the back and was talking to the other employees. All we could hear was laughing. She was leaning over talking to one of the guys. She came back. The lady and I asked her if they are making guacamole. She said "oh! I'm so sorry. I forgot." The lady next to me said f* it and walked out. I was furious as well but I was also hungry.

Another time I went there. This older Mexican lady was making my significant other and I our burrito. When we asked her what we want. She would put a very small amount in the burrito. We both looked at each other and asked her to add a little more. Then she rolled her eyes. My significant other and I was shocked. Later that day. We called and complained on how rude and unprofessional she was. There was a second time she did the same thing. We told to but a little more. She would reply: "that is going to be extra". I was livid that she was being that way. Usually when we see her. We usually drive away because we don't want to deal with that bs. Went haven't went back.

Just today, as my significant other and I got off work. We decided hopefully something might change. Maybe they might possibly cleaned up there act. He went inside and place an order for our burrito. He asked for guacamole on the side. They told him that they didn't have any. But they are going to make some right at the moment. He asked how long would it take? They told him 10 minutes. Other 2 people where waiting for the same thing. One of the workers on the line yells that they need guacamole. Him and the other people that were waiting heard laughing and being rude. They were all giving them the stink eye. My significant felt really offended that how sh**ty these people were being. 20 minutes went by and they came out with the guacamole and filled the cup almost full. To top it off, the lady named Brooke was frustrated and was giving him attitude. He came back really pissed off and told me the whole story about his experience. Once again, it was shocking to hear him explain on what just happened.

I hate this "restaurant".  Steam table meats and rice stuffed into a store-bought tortilla?  Yum!!!  

Btw, rice does not belong in a burrito.  Especially in this case since it is pure filler.  They use around 3 ounces of actual meat in their burritos I'm estimating.  Their salsas suck and the hot-sauces are canned and I hate the fake branding,  So twee and cool and hip and unoriginal and appealing... to teen-agers.  I have a teen-aged daughter.  She loves Chipotle.  I've noticed that the more she loves something the worse it is.  There you have it...

This place is fake and bad and pure filler.

Smart, friendly people and good food. Ask for a sprinkle of cilantro it's a fabulous addition to your burrito paradise experience! Yumma! I also love a place where the left-overs are still delicious, you know what I'm saying? Toaster oven that bowl, BAM! New meal LOL...I dig it. The service people at this location are just the plus they are always smiling, and have everything prepared in a proper flow fresh but ready to go! I dig it. Kitty approved!

Wow some of their meat is salty. Like, really, really salty. Like, "I am not going to continue to consume this" salty. Yikes. Service was pretty rushed and disorganized, too. And to be a bit more anal, close to $2 for a small dollop of guac? That's a pretty nice profit margin for them!

So nasty THERE WAS BLOOD ON MY STEAK BOWL!!!

I was so disgusted and the customer service is terrible they stood around talking for 5 minutes before helping me and the cashier was clearly intoxicated and had a strong liquor smell on her breath.

MY VISIT WAS HORRENDOUS I WILL NEVER GO THIS CHIPOTLE EVER AGAIN!!!!!!!

That don't impress me much! I was disappointed with my last visit. One of my boy toys brought me here for a quick lunch while running errands. I ordered a chicken bowl that was sparse. I ordered a flour tortilla on the side wrapped in foil. I had to ask that they reheat it. They gave me a replacement that was hot, resolved. 

The food is fresh, I just don't think the consistency is as good at this location compared to others.

The new Sofritas (tofu mixed with spicy peppers) tacos are pretty tasty. I added 2 kinds of salsa, pico & corn to mine to bulk them up. Fresh is the name of the game at Chipotle, and is also why this place is usually busy. 
Once you make it to place your order, the line moves quickly. They have the options of burrito, bowl or tacos with the meat & veggie choices, and then you customize your desired toppings.

Sometimes I find it difficult to eat Mexican food because I am such a picky eater. I do love tacos and nachos, but it has to be made simple. Unfortunately, I don't like beans, tomatoes, onions, jalape√±os, hot sauce, etc. For this reason, Chipotle is GREAT! I can order anything on their menu, just the way I want it! I like their fresh ingredients and watching the employees make my food. So far my favorites are the soft tacos and salad. Very delicious! Usually, I need at least a small amount of dressing on my salads, but I can eat this one without it! 

I have only ordered take out at this location, but the restaurant has always been very clean and organized. The employees are very friendly as well. During my last visit, I ordered the chicken soft tacos. Although it looked like they had enough chicken to fill up my tacos, they kindly asked if I wanted to wait another 2 minutes for a fresh batch and I agreed. 

I'm not sure how much healthier the food is here, but it sure is a better alternative to Taco Bell or Del Taco!

This is a convenient location with decent service, but there were a few glitches during my visit. 

The first girl who helped me was very nice and I put my order in with her but then another girl stepped in. She seemed to be attempting to expedite the orders but all she succeeded in doing is confusing everyone and making it take longer. 

Since I had already made my requests with the first girl it was a little annoying that she required me to reiterate my order with her. She misheard me and ended up putting the wrong proteins in my order. When I told her about the mistake she seemed annoyed and then the whole line got discombobulated as they had to redo my order and couldn't figure out how to expedite that while handling all the orders behind me. 

Once they got everything back on track things went smoothly but I was a little perturbed about her attitude. 

Food was decent once I got it home and everyone but that one particular employ was fine.
